item.title: 贝宁计划今年首次发行非洲美元债券，目标规模达10亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，贝宁计划通过发行美元计价的伊斯兰债券及其他贷款证券筹集高达10亿美元资金，这将是今年非洲首个主权债务发行项目。【原文：Benin is set to raise as much as $1 billion from a sale of dollar-denominated sukuk bonds and other loan securities in what would be the first African sovereign-debt offering this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 佩特罗创纪录的23%工资涨幅引发哥伦比亚经济连锁反应
item.description: 哥伦比亚政府正试图对某些商品价格实施上限管控，以应对其创纪录的最低工资上调所引发的一系列意外后果。【原文：Colombia’s government is trying to cap some prices as it grapples with a series of unintended consequences from its record minimum wage hike.】

item.title: 埃弗科报告：私募二级市场交易额飙升至创纪录的2260亿美元
item.description: 埃弗科公司在一份报告中指出，去年私有资产的二级交易量激增41%，达到创纪录的2260亿美元，投资者正以更具创造性的方式利用该市场获取流动性。【原文：Secondary deal volume for private assets surged 41% to a record $226 billion last year, Evercore Inc. said in a report, as investors got more creative about tapping that market for liquidity.】

item.title: 所罗门合伙公司任命大卫·希夫曼领导投资银行业务
item.description: 由法国兴业银行集团支持的精品投行所罗门合伙公司（Solomon Partners）任命大卫·A·希夫曼（David A. Shiffman）为投资银行部主管。随着这家咨询公司扩大高级管理团队，该职位为新设立的岗位。【原文：Solomon Partners, the boutique investment bank backed by Natixis SA, has appointed David A. Shiffman as head of investment banking, a newly created role as the advisory firm expands its senior leadership.】

item.title: 石油探矿者哈姆暂停巴肯地区的钻探作业
item.description: 对全球原油过剩的担忧已对油价构成压力，拖累了利润。【原文：Concerns over a global crude glut have pressured prices, weighing on profits.】

item.title: 亿万富豪皮尼亚塔罗旗下ION部门高管离职
item.description: 据知情人士透露，微软公司前高管已离开意大利信用信息公司Cerved集团。该公司隶属于亿万富翁安德烈亚·皮尼亚塔罗旗下的ION集团。【原文：A former Microsoft Corp. executive has left Cerved Group, the Italian credit-information company that is part of billionaire Andrea Pignataro’s ION Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 南非兰特汇率有望创下2002年以来最长连涨纪录
item.description: 南非兰特正延续着二十多年来罕见的周度连涨势头，贵金属价格走高与经济环境改善共同推动了其升值。【原文：South Africa’s rand is on a weekly winning run not seen in more than two decades as elevated precious-metal prices and an improving economic backdrop drive gains.】

item.title: 莫迪及其盟友在孟买选举中横扫全场，目标是基础设施大改造
item.description: 莫迪总理领导的政党首次在孟买市政选举中取得压倒性胜利，终结了地方政党数十年的统治，彰显了他在印度金融中心城市居民中的高人气。【原文：Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party swept the local municipality polls in Mumbai for the first time, ending decades of control by regional parties and underscoring his popularity among the urban population in India’s financial capital.】

item.title: 哈罗德·哈姆因油价下跌暂停巴肯页岩区钻探
item.description: 哈罗德·哈姆——这位助推美国页岩油革命的亿万富翁石油探勘者表示，由于原油价格低迷，他即将首次在数十年来关闭北达科他州巴肯地区的钻井作业。【原文：Harold Hamm, the billionaire wildcatter who helped kick off the US shale oil revolution, said he’s about to shut down drilling in North Dakota’s Bakken for the first time in decades because of low crude prices.】

item.title: 巴西经济活动增幅超出分析师预期
item.description: 巴西11月经济活动增速超出预期，周五公布的数据显示，这令市场对该国央行即将启动降息的预期趋于谨慎。【原文：Brazil’s economic activity picked up more than expected in November according to data published on Friday, adding caution to expectations that the central bank will start lowering borrowing costs soon.】

item.title: 微软和Meta启动数据中心公关攻势
item.description: 数据中心在当地社区并不受欢迎。微软和Meta正开展公关活动来扭转这种局面。【原文：Data centers aren’t popular with local communities. Microsoft and Meta are running PR campaigns to fix that.】

item.title: 美国经济数据的韧性掩盖了潜在的滞胀风险
item.description: 美国经济增长势头强劲，但生活成本压力再度攀升。【原文：US growth appears to be going strong. but cost-of-living pressures are building again】

item.title: 印度与欧盟贸易协定将包含部分农产品，官员称
item.description: 印度与欧盟的贸易协定将涵盖部分农产品，同时排除可能损害国内农民利益的项目。新德里一位高级官员表示，双方正逐步接近签署这项谈判多年的协议。【原文：India’s trade deal with the European Union will include some agricultural products while excluding items that could harm domestic farmers, a senior official in New Delhi said, as the two sides inch closer to signing an agreement that has been under negotiation for years.】

item.title: EG集团寻求银行支持，计划今年在美国进行首次公开募股
item.description: 据知情人士透露，EG集团正为今年在美国进行首次公开募股（IPO）物色承销银行，此次上市可能使这家加油站运营商的估值高达90亿美元。【原文：EG Group is lining up banks for an initial public offering in the US this year that could value the gas station operator at as much as $9 billion, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 特斯拉需要数周时间审查8,313起潜在交通违规行为
item.description: 美国监管机构批准特斯拉公司延长五周时间，以开始处理针对其车辆在全自动驾驶系统启用时违反交通法规的缺陷调查。【原文：US regulators granted Tesla Inc. a five-week extension to start addressing a defect investigation into cars violating traffic laws while the company’s Full Self-Driving system is engaged.】

item.title: PNC银行营收超预期，得益于资本市场业务手续费激增
item.description: PNC金融服务集团公布第四季度营收增长9%，超出分析师预期，主要得益于中型市场客户融资与交易活动的加速。【原文：PNC Financial Services Group Inc. reported a 9% increase in fourth-quarter revenue, beating analysts’ estimates as financing and dealmaking by middle-market customers accelerated.】

item.title: 驶往俄罗斯的幽灵油轮在波罗的海调头返航
item.description: 一艘在海事数据库中显示从未存在过的油轮，在驶向德国水域时突然调头，目前正朝着俄罗斯北极海岸航行。【原文：An oil tanker that shows up on maritime databases as having never existed U-turned as it headed toward German waters and is now sailing in the direction of Russia’s Arctic coast.】

item.title: 信贷市场二十年来未见如此火热
item.description:
安本和太平洋投资管理公司表示，公司债券投资者需要警惕自满情绪。 

【原文：

Corporate bond investors need to guard against complacency, Aberdeen and Pimco say. 

】

item.title: 阿尔森特拉寻求6亿欧元资金用于困境债务基金
item.description: 据知情人士透露，另类信贷管理公司Alcentra Ltd.正在筹集一只新基金，用于投资特殊情况下的投资机会。【原文：Alternative credit manager Alcentra Ltd. is raising a new fund to invest in special situations, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 萨克斯债券仅值1美分，令对冲基金蒙受惨痛教训
item.description: 乍看之下，萨克斯正是对冲基金最爱的混乱局面。【原文：At first glance, Saks looked like exactly the kind of mess hedge funds love.】

item.title: 特朗普的信用卡威胁给大型银行的盈利游行泼了冷水
item.description: 唐纳德·特朗普总统突然要求对信用卡利率设限，导致本周金融股暴跌，同时华尔街各大贷款机构的负责人在季度财报电话会议上被问得措手不及。【原文：President Donald Trump’s unexpected demand for a cap on credit card interest rates sent financial shares tumbling this week, while leaving the heads of Wall Street’s biggest lenders fielding a swarm of questions on their quarterly earnings calls.】

item.title: 英格兰银行行长贝利称民粹主义恐加剧全球问题
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁·贝利表示，民粹主义正使应对全球经济挑战变得更加困难，它无法解决经济增长乏力和生活水平低下的问题。【原文：Populism is making it harder to tackle the world’s economic challenges and is no answer to the problems of weak growth and living standards, Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey said.】

item.title: 据称，Alantra等公司正考虑出售西班牙Salto Systems的股权
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Salto Systems SL公司的一批股东正考虑出售其持有的这家西班牙电子锁制造商的股份。【原文：A group of shareholders in Salto Systems SL are weighing a sale of their stakes in the Spanish electronic locks manufacturer, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 过去十年间美国石油行业流失的40%岗位不会再回来了
item.description:
自2014年页岩气泡沫破灭以来，石油巨头们在生产效率方面取得了显著提升，仅凭少量劳动力便实现了创纪录的产量。

【原文：

Oil majors have grown more efficient in the years since the shale bubble burst in 2014, pumping record production with a fraction of the workforce.

】

item.title: 华尔街对股市表现最佳板块意见分歧
item.description: 在地区地缘政治紧张局势加剧的背景下，能源股的强劲涨势持续跑赢大盘，引发了关于这波涨势能持续多久的讨论。【原文：A market-beating rally in energy stocks amid flaring geopolitical tensions has sparked a debate about how long the momentum will last.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利预测ASML股价在乐观情景下将飙升70%
item.description: 摩根士丹利阐述了其看涨论点，解释为何投资者应买入ASML控股公司股票。该行表示，在最乐观的情景下，随着芯片制造商加大支出以满足人工智能领域激增的需求，该股未来有望上涨70%。【原文：Morgan Stanley laid out its bullish case for why investors should buy ASML Holding NV shares, saying in the most optimistic scenario the stock has a 70% rally ahead as chipmakers ramp up spending to meet soaring demand for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 英特尔延续复苏势头，投资者押注代工业务增长
item.description: 英特尔公司年初的强劲反弹表明，投资者对其赢得新代工客户日益乐观，这将使该公司重返2024年看似已放弃的人工智能领域。【原文：Intel Corp.’s dramatic rally to start the year shows investors are increasingly optimistic about the chipmaker gaining new foundry customers, putting it back into the artificial intelligence trade it appeared to abandon in 2024.】

item.title: 巴克莱称印度推进自贸协定或难抵消美国关税拖累
item.description: 巴克莱银行经济学家表示，印度近期签署和拟议的多项自由贸易协定，可能不足以抵消美国关税对这个南亚国家出口的影响。【原文：India’s recent spate of signed and proposed free-trade agreements may not be sufficient to offset the impact of US tariffs on the South Asian country’s exports, economists at Barclays Plc said.】

item.title: 韩国交易所考虑推出风险较高的ETF以吸引散户投资者
item.description: 韩国主要证券交易所正与金融监管机构商讨放宽对高风险杠杆交易所交易产品的禁令，因本土股市创纪录的上涨未能吸引散户投资者重返国内市场。【原文：South Korea’s main bourse is in talks with financial authorities to ease rules that ban high-risk leveraged exchange-traded products, as a record rally in local shares has failed to draw retail investors back to the domestic market.】

item.title: 船只逐步重返红海迎来关键里程碑
item.description: 在避开红海航线两年多后，全球主要集装箱航运公司正逐步重返这条东西向贸易的重要航道，并表示该航线已恢复安全航行。【原文：After more than two years of avoiding the Red Sea, the world’s leading container lines are inching back to the vital lane for east-west trade and indicating it looks safe to navigate again.】
